span.br: This web page was created to provide resources and keep the Oneida City School District community informed. This page will continue to be updated as new and relevant information emerges, so please check back regularly.

p.span:
On behalf of the Oneida City School District, we hope you and your families are remaining safe and doing your best to follow guidance regarding measures to contain the spread of COVID-19 within our community. Events have continued to unfold, and we recognize that this raises questions about potential impacts on students, families and our full community. Where answers exist, we will work quickly to provide them. However, we anticipate that many other questions
will require additional research and/or consultation with local, state or federal officials.
Click HERE for latest news articles regarding school closures.

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

span.style: box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

span.style: box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

p.span: On April 16, 2020, Governor Cuomo issued an executive order that schools should be closed through May 15, 2020. If we receive additional information, we will share it will our families.

span.style: text-decoration: underline; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
text-decoration: underline; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

span.br: The district was notified on March 30th at 4:56 PM from the NYS Education Department that all “districts must continue to provide remote instruction for students, meals for students, and child care for essential workers every weekday between April 1, 2020 and April 14, 2020, even if the district is scheduled to be on spring break during that time.” This decision can be found in Governor Cuomo’s executive order 202.11. As a result, our teachers will continue to provide instructional from April 3-April 29.

a.title: This link will redirect you to the iLearning Model

span.a: Click HERE to be redirected to learn more about the iLearning Model.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
p.span: During this current health crisis you may be considered an essential employee who is still required to work. Child care placement is available to personnel who provide essential services, supplies, or support during this time.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

span.span: If you believe that you may qualify, please call the Oneida-Herkimer-Madison Child Care Resource Center at 315-223-7850 extension 222. You may also complete this

a.span: parent need for child care survey

span.span: . Based on the information you provide about your job, employer, number of children, and financial need, assistance may be provided.

p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;

span.span: Thank you to all essential personnel who continue to protect and support our community. Please be safe, and whenever possible, stay at home.

br.br: UPDATED: Instructional programs will be closed beginning Monday, March 16 through May 15th.

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 19px; line-height: normal; font-family: Arial; -webkit-text-stroke-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin: 0px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
p.span: If you have any questions or need any assistance, please do not call the buildings as the buildings will be closed and there will be nobody there to answer. Instead, please email your school building’s main office.

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 19px; line-height: normal; font-family: Arial; -webkit-text-stroke-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin: 0px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

box-sizing: border-box; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 19px; line-height: normal; font-family: Arial; -webkit-text-stroke-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin: 0px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

box-sizing: border-box; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 19px; line-height: normal; font-family: Arial; -webkit-text-stroke-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin: 0px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

box-sizing: border-box; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 19px; line-height: normal; font-family: Arial; -webkit-text-stroke-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin: 0px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

box-sizing: border-box; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 19px; line-height: normal; font-family: Arial; -webkit-text-stroke-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin: 0px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

box-sizing: border-box; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 19px; line-height: normal; font-family: Arial; -webkit-text-stroke-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin: 0px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

span.br: Superintendent’s Conference Day was rescheduled to Monday, March 16. This provided our instructional staff with time to prepare materials and plans for students to utilize while they are home.

li.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 17px; line-height: normal; font-family: Arial; -webkit-text-stroke-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin: 0px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
li.span: Instructional Material Pickup-Students had the opportunity to pick up materials on Monday, March 16th, at their building from 12p.m.- 3p.m.

li.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 17px; line-height: normal; font-family: Arial; -webkit-text-stroke-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin: 0px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
li.span:
Any students who were not able to pick up their packets had them mailed home by their respective buildings.
Online-Some middle school and high school work may also be available online.

li.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-stretch: normal; font-size: 17px; line-height: normal; font-family: Arial; -webkit-text-stroke-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); margin: 0px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

span.style: box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

br.br: The Oneida City School District will be providing a FREE combined breakfast and lunch grab-and-go meal starting Tuesday, March 17 - Tuesday, April 13 Monday - Friday to all families with students currently enrolled at Oneida CSD who are 18 and under.

br.style: box-sizing: border-box; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: "Helvetica Neue", Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px;

span.style: box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

br.span: Please call the district office 315-363-2550, ext. 3. to sign up

span.style: box-sizing: border-box; font-family: Arial; font-size: 16px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);

br.span: Meals will be ready for pickup on Tuesday, March 17th. Pick up time will be from 8:45-9:45am.

br.strong: Please click on the links below to read letters from Superintendent, Mary-Margaret Zehr addressing the district's measures to protect students and staff from the coronavirus.
